content: dichotomy this simple hat is a two-in-one it s reversible both sides are knit with the same stitch pattern but when worked in different colors it gives you choices for your winter wardrobe mix and match bases to achieve different fabrics on either side of the hat how does a cashmere or fluffy mohair base sound for the lining notes sizes finished circumference 20 22 24 inches  if you are between sizes i recommend sizing up  sample was knit in size 22 for a 21 head needles  size us 2/2 75 mm 16 circular knitting needles  size us 4/3 5 mm 16 circular knitting needles  size us 4/3 5 mm dpns or long circular needles for magic loop yarn  mc1 185 yds/170 m fingering weight yarn your mc1 and mc2 yarns will be striped on o sample used the plucky knitter - oxford in colorway maverick one side of the hat so they should and goose coordinate if preferred use a single color  mc2 25 yds/20 m fingering weight yarn and simply combine these two yardages o sample used the plucky knitter - oxford in colorway atticus  cc 210 yds/190 m fingering weight yarn your cc yarn will be used individually on the other side of the hat o sample used the plucky knitter - oxford in colorway ron notions stitch marker tapestry needle gauge 20 sts x 32 row = 4 x 4 broken rib worked flat  broken rib across an even number of sts on rs knit across on ws *k1 p1* across dichotomy pg 1 abbreviations co cast on st/sts stitch/stitches k/p knit/purl sl1-k2tog-psso slip one stitch purlwise knit the next two sts together then pass the slipped st over the k2tog decreases two helpful methods provisional cast on this method keeps live sts at the co edge which are kept from unraveling by some length of waste yarn these stitches are picked up later and worked in the other direction here is the method i recommend https //www youtube com/watch v=dxp8runxjty this hat starts with a provisional co beginning at the color interface one side of the hat is knit entirely before proceeding to the other side of the hat and after finishing the second side you simply fold one it inward directions using size us 2 needles and your mc1 yarn provisionally co 112 120 128 sts work 1x1 ribbing for 2 or until the desired brim length switch to size us 4 needles round 1 knit round 2 *k1 p1* around to add stripes work the rounds 1-2 in the following pattern after finishing the brim three repeats in mc1 two repeats in mc2 tip when switching colors be sure to start the new color on a knit round to one repeat in mc1 create a smoother color transition two repeats in mc2 cut mc2 work rounds 1-2 in mc1 until the piece measures 8 from the co edge crown decreases for size 20 begin
